name: Dhul-Qarnayn Story Graph - Enhanced Ontology
description: Fully reconstructed story graph for Surah Al-Kahf (18:83-98) with semantic ordering, narrative roles, and tafsir evidence

story.summary_ar: قصة الملك الصالح الذي مكّنه الله في الأرض فسافر مشرقاً ومغرباً ناشراً العدل، وبنى السد حماية للمستضعفين من يأجوج ومأجوج
story.summary_en: The story of a righteous ruler whom Allah empowered on earth. He traveled east and west spreading justice, and built a barrier to protect the oppressed from Yajuj and Majuj.
story.lessons_ar: القوة مسؤولية، العدل واجب، التواضع مع النعمة، والتوكل على الله
story.lessons_en: Power is responsibility, justice is duty, humility with blessing, and reliance on Allah

segments.summary_ar: يُسأل النبي ﷺ عن ذي القرنين، وهذا يدل على شهرته وأهمية قصته
segments.summary_en: The Prophet (PBUH) is asked about Dhul-Qarnayn, indicating his fame and the importance of his story.
key_points_en: Quraysh asked to test the Prophet
Dhul-Qarnayn was known to People of the Book

evidence_sources.snippet: سألوا النبي ﷺ عن ذي القرنين بإيعاز من اليهود لاختباره

segments.memorization_cue_en: Why did they ask? To test the Prophet.

segments.summary_ar: مكّن الله ذا القرنين في الأرض وآتاه من كل شيء سبباً - القوة والعلم والموارد
segments.summary_en: Allah established Dhul-Qarnayn on earth and gave him the means to everything - power, knowledge, and resources.
key_points_en: This was divine blessing, not self-made

evidence_sources.snippet: مكناه في الأرض أي ملّكناه وأعطيناه سلطاناً واسعاً
وآتيناه من كل شيء سبباً: أي علماً بالطرق والوسائل

segments.summary_ar: اتبع سبباً حتى وصل مغرب الشمس فوجدها تغرب في عين حمئة ووجد عندها قوماً
segments.summary_en: He followed a way until he reached the setting of the sun, which appeared to set in a murky spring, and found a people there.
key_points_en: 'Followed a sabab' = used the means Allah gave
Found a people = civilization at western limit

evidence_sources.snippet: سار حتى انتهى إلى أقصى ما يسلكه من أرض المغرب

segments.memorization_cue_en: West journey: Sun sets, people found

segments.summary_ar: خُيّر بين العقاب والإحسان، فاختار العدل: يُعذّب الظالم ويُحسن للمؤمن
segments.summary_en: Given choice between punishment and kindness, he chose justice: punish the oppressor, reward the believer.
key_points_en: Allah gave him choice = test of character

evidence_sources.snippet: قلنا يا ذا القرنين إما أن تعذب وإما أن تتخذ فيهم حسنا - خيره الله بين الأمرين
هذا تخيير بين القتال والدعوة، وهو اختبار لعدله

segments.summary_ar: اتبع سبباً آخر حتى بلغ مطلع الشمس على قوم لم يجعل لهم من دونها ستراً
segments.summary_en: He followed another way until he reached the rising of the sun over a people for whom Allah had not made any shield against it.

evidence_sources.snippet: قوم لا بناء لهم ولا أشجار تظلهم من الشمس

segments.summary_ar: كذلك - لم يظلمهم ولم يستغلهم رغم ضعفهم، وأحاط الله علماً بما لديه
segments.summary_en: Kadhalika (thus it was) - he did not oppress or exploit them despite their vulnerability. Allah encompassed what he had.

evidence_sources.snippet: كذلك أي كما فعل بأهل المغرب فعل بأهل المشرق
وقد أحطنا بما لديه خبراً - الله شاهد على أعماله

segments.memorization_cue_en: TEST 2: Power over weak, chose restraint

segments.summary_ar: وجد قوماً بين السدين لا يكادون يفقهون قولاً، يشكون من إفساد يأجوج ومأجوج
segments.summary_en: He found a people between two mountains who could barely understand speech, suffering from the corruption of Yajuj and Majuj.

evidence_sources.snippet: قوم بين جبلين لا يفهمون لغة غيرهم، يشكون فساد يأجوج ومأجوج
يأجوج ومأجوج قبيلتان من ولد يافث بن نوح

segments.memorization_cue_en: Third stop: Oppressed ask for help

segments.summary_ar: عرضوا عليه جزية مقابل بناء سد، وهذا اختبار للطمع والاستغلال
segments.summary_en: They offered him tribute in exchange for building a barrier - a test of greed and exploitation.
key_points_en: Third test: accept money or serve freely?
Vulnerable people offering what little they have

evidence_sources.snippet: نجعل لك خرجاً - أي أجرة ومالاً

segments.memorization_cue_en: They offer money: Will he take it?

segments.summary_ar: قال ما مكني فيه ربي خير، يكفيني ما آتاني الله، فأعينوني بقوة
segments.summary_en: He said: What my Lord has established me in is better. Just help me with labor, and I will make a barrier.

evidence_sources.snippet: ما مكني فيه ربي خير - اعترف بأن كل ما عنده من الله
لا أريد منكم مالاً، أكتفي بما آتاني الله

segments.summary_ar: أمرهم بإحضار زبر الحديد ثم النفخ والإذابة والقطر، حتى بُني سد لا يُتسلق
segments.summary_en: He commanded them to bring iron blocks, then blow until red-hot, pour molten copper, creating an insurmountable barrier.

evidence_sources.snippet: زبر الحديد: قطع الحديد الكبيرة، ثم أذابها بالنار وصب عليها النحاس المذاب
هذا دليل على علمه بالصناعات والهندسة

segments.summary_ar: قال هذا رحمة من ربي، فإذا جاء وعد ربي جعله دكاء، وكان وعد ربي حقاً
segments.summary_en: He said: This is mercy from my Lord. When my Lord's promise comes, He will level it. And my Lord's promise is truth.

evidence_sources.snippet: هذا رحمة من ربي - نسب الفضل لله بعد إتمام العمل العظيم
فإذا جاء وعد ربي - يعني يوم القيامة حين يخرج يأجوج ومأجوج

segments.memorization_cue_en: After success: 'This is mercy from my Lord'

connections.explanation_en: The question introduces him, then Allah describes his empowerment
connections.justification_en: Quranic narrative order: question (83) immediately followed by description (84)

connections.explanation_en: Divine empowerment enabled the journeys - he 'followed a sabab' using what Allah gave
connections.justification_en: Verse 85 'fa-atba'a sababan' (he followed a means) directly references the 'sabab' given in verse 84

connections.explanation_en: Arriving at the west, he faced the first test of justice
connections.justification_en: Sequential narrative: arrival (85-86a) then moral choice (86b-88)

connections.explanation_en: After completing the western mission, he journeyed east
connections.justification_en: Verse 89 'thumma atba'a sababan' (then he followed another means) indicates sequence

connections.explanation_en: Upon reaching the east, he exercised restraint with the vulnerable people
connections.justification_en: Verses 89-91: arrival at east, then 'kadhalika' indicating his similar just treatment

connections.explanation_en: After the eastern lands, he continued to the barrier region
connections.justification_en: Verse 92 'thumma atba'a sababan' indicates third journey

connections.explanation_en: The oppressed people made their request for help
connections.justification_en: Verse 94: direct speech 'qalu' (they said) follows encounter description

connections.explanation_en: Their tribute offer was tested; he refused, showing his character
connections.justification_en: Verse 95 'qala' (he said) is direct response to their offer in 94

connections.explanation_en: After refusing payment, he proceeded to build with their labor
connections.justification_en: Verse 95 ends with 'fa-a'inuni bi-quwwatin' then 96 describes construction

connections.explanation_en: Upon completing the great work, he attributed it to Allah's mercy
connections.justification_en: Verse 98 'qala' follows completion in 97; humility after achievement

connections.explanation_en: Both are tests of his character when given power over people
connections.justification_en: Tabari: 'kadhalika' (18:91) explicitly links his behavior in east to west

connections.explanation_en: Divine empowerment at start vs. humility at end - arc of righteous leadership
connections.justification_en: Narrative arc: given everything (84) yet attributes all to Allah (98)

connections.explanation_en: Both moments show his tawakkul and attribution to Allah
connections.justification_en: Same phrase pattern: 'ma makkani fihi rabbi' (95) echoes 'hadha rahmah min rabbi' (98)

cross_story_connections.explanation_en: Both stories in Surah Al-Kahf feature journeys seeking/using divine knowledge. Musa learns humility from Khidr; Dhul-Qarnayn demonstrates it through action.
Both were given extraordinary means by Allah and used power justly. Sulayman controlled jinn and wind; Dhul-Qarnayn had means to everything.

cross_story_connections.label_en: Continuation: Barrier until Day of Judgment
cross_story_connections.explanation_en: The barrier's destruction signals end-times events. Dhul-Qarnayn himself prophecied: 'When my Lord's promise comes, He will level it.'

key_lessons: Power is from Allah and must be used for justice
True leadership means serving without seeking payment
All achievements must be attributed to Allah's mercy
Physical constructs are temporary; divine promise is eternal
